comment: Hard for no reason. I did not expect a free A, but I was hoping for a relaxing class among difficult STEM classes. wrong. The readings were BORING. Quizzes were easy 100, but discussion posts and essays that she ripped apart/graded crazy hard. I am a junior with a 4.0 gpa, but I BARELY pulled off a 90. Not the worst prof, but I dreaded this class.

She is a wonderful teacher and gives amazing feedback to each assignment! You can tell she cares about the subject and wants each student to actually learn the subject in an applicable way, not just acquire new information. She is rigorous but in an extremely fair and clear way. You get the grade you deserve. Loved her class and would do it again!

Dr. GuramatunhuCooper is difficult for the sake of it; she is unflinching in her rigidity and approaches teaching like she is omnipotent. Her assignments are vague (though she claims this is to allow "agency"), and she is readily unavailable when you have questions. Don't do it to yourself -- it isn't worth it.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Tough grader

comment: This prof really challenges you to show up and participate. There was weekly quizes of only like 5 questions so if you missed one you were screwed. But if you read her softchalk module and take notes you will be fine! Overall she is a very respected woman and is so intellegent. You show up and do the work youll be fine!
rating_tags: Respected--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She grades on a 100 point scale, so if you mess up anything, you're done for. She's a super hard grader, it is literally impossible to get a 100 on an assignment. Point and case, I took for upper division classes, and got a 100 in three of them, yet in this class, I only got an 88. If you're going for the leadership certification, avoid taking her.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: She is a very tough grader and does not care about the student getting a good grade in the class. She makes the course much harder than it should be. She should make the course more simple. She also makes you write a 5 page essay without proper guidelines and specifications!

Expects you to come up with a solution even if there is nothing that can be done , very harsh grader. makes the course harder than it should be. Does not like to cooperate with students when asking for help she simply sends you to the D2L instructions when they make no sense. to get full marks on any assignment is basically impossible.

Quite possibly the worst professor/teacher I have ever had. She makes you do a 5 page paper that makes no sense. She was incredibly rude to me and provided unclear instructions throughout the course. She only told me that I would fail or get a D AFTER the withdrawal date, so she basically wasted the money that I had. She DOESN'T CARE ABOUT YOU.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--So many papers

comment: Going into this course I didn't know what to be expecting but I was beyond pleased. This was the first class I've taken at Kennesaw that actually made me want to get involved and this was because of professor GuramatunhuCooper. While some may see her as a tough person in my opinion she just wants the best for her students. I highly recommend.

took 7 wk session. I could tell she actually cared about her classes. She gives feedback quickly. didn't do well on the first test but it was my fault. Easy A if you are willing to do the work, seriously. Not hard work at all, you just have to participate in the discussions multiple days throughout the week. organized. wish more profs were like her
I took this class this summer and it was an easy A, open book test and 4 discussion boards. She is a really nice lady.

She make the class harder then it should be. The discussion post has 3 parts to them with a 125 words limit. I would not recommend her if you are taking other classes. Her class is like a full load by itself. She is a tough grader. I have plans to re-take this class if offered by someone else to be eligible for the Leadership certificate.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: She changes her course structure per semester so keep that in mind when choosing her. She takes what worked well with previous classes and incorporates it with new ones and will ask for class feedback. GIVE IT. Class is discussion heavy so read up on the topics, she even gives you a condensed version on D2L. Quizzes are difficult but no final.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Not one that I would recommend at all!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Dr. GuramatunhuCooper is HUGE on class participation. She expects you to show up and engage in the discussion for the day. If you sit in class and don't contribute to the discussion she WILL call on you.  She covers a lot of race and minority issues so you must be extremely open minded when taking this class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: She is a great professor in my opinion. She will not baby you at all. Do what she ask and you will do well. If you are confused ask her for clarification. Know what needs to be done ahead of time. The material is very interesting and she is very knowledgeable on the content. Would recommend taking her!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: Dr GuramatunhuCooper is a nice and respectful professor. This class is HARD though. We had a difficult midterm, reading reflections on chapters we read, a final paper(instead of a final), and a group project(she likes to change things up, though). Attendance was a big part of the grade(you can miss up to 3 times). We had great discussions.

Dr. G is one amazing professor. If you are looking for an easy A, this is not the professor to choose. But if you're interested in the subject, and you want to be pushed to be better then this is the professor for you! She's really relatable, and fun to listen to.

She's tough, I'm not going to lie to you, but if you do WHAT SHE ASKS you will do well. She is more than willing to help each and every student that comes to her door, but she will not coddle you. She teaches with tough love for sure, but she does it well. I would rank her as one of the top 5 classes of my college career for sure.

Makes this class much harder than it should her discussion question are like a paper every week no extra credit no make assignments out of touch with reality of students lives. Don't take her with more than one other class.

If you don't enjoy writing then this is NOT the teacher for you. Several lengthy papers and even the midterm and final are essays (not a standard test w multiple choice) Even the discussion posts  require title page & reference pages! She grades fairly and offers amazing feedback on every single writing assignment! No surprises in this class

I hate her teaching methods. Teaches from powerpoints. I learned nothing. A lot of the group projects don't pertain to lectures. Assignment & test are take-home but instructions are unclear. Ask any questions you can think of when she hands out the test. Do news briefs the day before class. Don't be late or leave early. Will negotiate class time.
